message.content:
cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NI 

The paper deals with the optimization and control of power demand scheduling in the smart power grid, which involves the use of information and communication technologies. This suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) category. The paper also discusses the use of a stochastic model and optimization algorithms, which could place it in the cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.LG (Machine Learning) categories. Additionally, the paper proposes threshold-based policies for power consumption control, which could be related to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of real-time communication between the grid operator and consumers, which could be related to the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) category.
